org.team3309.lib.controllers

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team3309.lib.controllers.Controller
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlankController, DriveBasicEquationController, PIDController

    public abstract class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The basis of any Controller. A Controller can be made to calculate values that can be then applied in a ControllerSubsystem.
    Author:
    TheMkrage

      Tells if Controller is enabled or not.

      abstract OutputSignal getOutputSignal(InputState inputState)
      Should be ran one time each loop, tells the subsystem what to do based off of the controller.
      abstract boolean isCompleted()
      Tells if the controller is done executed its specified task.
      abstract void reset()
      Resets the Controller.

        public boolean mEnabled
        Tells if Controller is enabled or not.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets the Controller. For example, reseting the integral term back to zero in a PID Loop

      • getOutputSignal

        public abstract OutputSignal getOutputSignal(InputState inputState)
        Should be ran one time each loop, tells the subsystem what to do based off of the controller.
        Parameters:
        inputState - The state of the ControlledSubsystem
        Returns:
        The signal sent to the ControlledSubsystem

      • isCompleted

        public abstract boolean isCompleted()
        Tells if the controller is done executed its specified task.
        Returns:
        boolean telling if controller is done or not
